definition: to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: To determine whether a syllable is closed or open, look at the vowel.
sentences.chinese: 首先看看英文教程中关于开音节与闭音节的描述。

sentences.english: Find out all the open and closed syllables from the textbook.
sentences.chinese: 找出课本中的开音节和闭音节单词。

definition: (phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
polysyllabic word/Chinese word made up of three or more characters
diphthong (such as putonghua ɑi, ei etc)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
